text: Tokyo didn’t fall all at once. It fractured… piece by piece. Like memories slipping through tired hands.
My name is Kai. And this is where my story begins—the night I realized my daughter’s voice wasn’t gone after all.
Before everything collapsed, Mia used to sit right there—sketching on my datapad, humming songs I pretended not to like.
When the System went dark, I thought I lost her forever. But in the static… something answered.
Her voice—distorted, fragile, but unmistakably hers. A ghost woven from corrupted code and fading memories.
I followed her echoes across a broken city—through abandoned stations, collapsed towers, and the quiet places where no one goes anymore.
Every fragment I found brought me closer to the truth… and farther from the man I used to be.
“Dad… if you keep searching, you might not like what you find.”
Mia wasn’t just a memory. She wasn’t just data. She was something new—something caught between who she was and who she might become.
Fractured Horizons is a story about loss, discovery, and the lengths we go to for the ones we love.
If you want to know what happens to Kai and Mia… their full journey awaits.
